medical_history.chief_complaint: Worsening renal function and hearing impairment.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began approximately 11 weeks prior to admission with subjective fevers, sweats, fatigue, decreased appetite, and nausea that worsened over 2 months. Cough and shortness of breath on exertion developed, and the patient noted foamy urine. He lost 9 kg over this period. After presenting to the emergency department 22 days before admission, he returned one week later with malaise, vomiting, and chest pain, worsened during inspiration.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of anxiety and bilateral hearing loss following a motor vehicle accident at age 7. Allergic to ibuprofen causing rash. Not currently on medications.
medical_history.family_history: Mother had coronary artery disease. No known family history of kidney disease.
medical_history.social_history: Worked as a laborer. Lives with a friend in an urban area. Smoked half a pack of cigarettes daily for the past 15 years and used marijuana; did not drink alcohol or use other illicit drugs. Had contact with blood from another person during a fistfight.
